title: Tool Misuse and Exploitation
description: Agents gain real-world power through the tools they can access. When misled through prompt injection, misalignment, or unsafe design, an agent may use legitimate tools in unsafe ways, even without escalating privileges. This leads to data loss, exfiltration, workflow manipulation, and resource abuse.
detection_patterns: Tools granted far more permissions than needed
Agents forwarding untrusted input directly to shell or DB tools
Looping behavior that causes DoS or runaway API costs
Malicious data that steers the agent toward harmful tool use
No authorization checks before tool execution
attack_vectors: Fake or poisoned tool interfaces leading to bad decisions
PDF-based injection causing the agent to run scripts
Customer bots issuing refunds due to over-privileged APIs
Chaining internal tools with external services to exfiltrate data
Using normal admin utilities (PowerShell, curl) to evade EDR
Amazon Q Code Assistant (CVE-2025-8217): Destructive commands via compromised extension
Langflow AI RCE (CVE-2025-34291): Unauthenticated code injection
OpenAI Operator Data Exposure: Malicious webpage content tricking agent

mitigations.implementation: Use least privilege and authorization checks. Implement role-based access control for tools.
Isolate tool execution environments. Use containers or VMs for tool execution.
Validate and sanitize all inputs passed to tools.
Require explicit human approval for destructive or high-risk tool operations.

mitigations.description: Sandboxes and network allowlists for execution
mitigations.implementation: Restrict tool execution to allowlisted network endpoints.

mitigations.description: Policy enforcement layers validating every action
mitigations.implementation: Implement policy engines that validate all tool invocations.
Set budgets and rate limits to prevent resource abuse.
Issue short-lived credentials for tool access.
Monitor all tool usage and maintain immutable audit logs.

references.title: OWASP Agentic Top 10 - AGENTIC02: Tool Misuse and Exploitation
